author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...BERYL BECOMES A POTENTIALLY CATASTROPHIC CATEGORY 5 HURRICANE  IN THE EASTERN CARIBBEAN... ...EXPECTED TO BRING LIFE-THREATENING WINDS AND STORM SURGE TO JAMAICA LATER THIS WEEK...
summary:
...BERYL BECOMES A POTENTIALLY CATASTROPHIC CATEGORY 5 HURRICANE  IN THE EASTERN CARIBBEAN... ...EXPECTED TO BRING LIFE-THREATENING WINDS AND STORM SURGE TO JAMAICA LATER THIS WEEK...
 As of 11:00 PM AST Mon Jul 1
 the center of Beryl was located near 13.8, -64.9
 with movement WNW at 22 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 938 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 160 mph.

title: Summary - Hurricane Beryl (AT2/AL022024)
